title: Manchester Airport Car Parking Expert List the Top Ten Stolen Cars of 2014
text:
UK Airport Car Parks has listed the top ten stolen cars of 2014 to make more people aware of why they should park their car at an airport car park while on holiday.
Today, a Manchester Airport Car Parking expert has listed the most popular cars that were stolen in 2014. UK Airport Car Parks listed the cars on their blog ( http://www.ukairportcarparks.co.uk/blog/airport-car-parks-security /) to make people understand how important it is to use an airport car park when planning to go abroad.
UK Airport Car Parks, who said the BMW X5 was in first place in 2014 for criminals to target, want people to understand that their car is vulnerable while they are on holiday. Although it can be a traumatic experience when a car has been stolen, a spokesman for the Manchester Airport Parking company has warned some car owners may not get paid out.
The Airport parking experts who provide a comparison tool so people can find the best deals on Airport parking has warned car owners not to use social media while on holiday.
A spokesman for UK Airport Car Parks said: "Insurance companies can now refuse to pay out on insurance claims if the owner has advertised they are going on holiday through social media."
According to UK Airport Car Parks, if an insurance has found a car owner has been letting people know they are on holiday through social media, they can refuse to pay out. An insurance company makes it clear it is down to the owner to make sure their vehicle is secure. However, if they people promote they are going on holiday and the car is left on the road, then it is not classed as secure if criminals know the owner is on holiday.
Chris Fryer from UK Airport Car Parks said: "Everyone likes to share pictures while they are on holiday, but with criminals now using social media to target empty houses and unattended cars, we advise people to keep away from Facebook while on holiday."
The cars that were popular with criminals in 2014 can be seen on the parking experts official blog ( http://www.ukairportcarparks.co.uk/blog/airport-car-parks-security/ ). By using an airport car park while going abroad, it allows the car owner to know it is safe. With the comparison tool provided on the site, car owners can now save up to 60% off normal prices.
